reg:regulation.reg:title:
Religious Charity Property Transfer Tax
Exemption Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: A transfer of land to a person is exempt from property transfer tax if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the land is held by the person for a congregation, religious organization or religious society under the Trustee (Church Property) Act, the Lutheran Student Foundation of British Columbia Act, The United Church of Canada Act, or An Act respecting the President of the Lethbridge Stake of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (Canada),
the congregation, religious organization or religious society is a registered charity as defined in section 248 (1) of the Income Tax Act (Canada), and
the land will be used for a charitable purpose.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Property Transfer Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 378, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 37 (2) (b)]
